BikeSack

Class BikeSack

  • java.lang.Object
    • BikeSack.BikeSack

  • public class BikeSack
extends java.lang.Object
    The Bike Sack is a complete motorcycle computer instrument and light control solution. Using a Raspberry PI hardware the Java based solution manages and monitors all aspects of a motorcycle's electrical system. Information collected about the current state of the bike is output to screen to keep the rider well informed.

    System produced as a group project for RMIT CPT111 Building IT Systems [BITS] SP2 2017.

    Course Instructor:

    Byron Fisher.

    Team Mentor:

    Edward Watkins.

    Team Leader

    Ben Denford

    Dev Team 1

    Steven Grueber, Aidan Holmes

    Dev Team 2

    Matthew Flack, Rhyan Watts
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Aidan Holmes | S3355003, Matthew Flack | S3493444, Steven Grueber | S3502715, Ben Denford | S3573670, Rhyan Watts | S3590266

      • setSensors

        public void setSensors(java.lang.String selection)
                throws SensorException
        Triggers the Sensor associated with the menu option selected.
        Parameters:
        selection - The input from the user
        Throws:
        SensorException - The Sensor was not able to be modified in the requested way

        private void setDummySensorValues()
                           throws SensorException
        Sets the Sensor to have plausible defaults since we don't have real sensors
        Throws:
        SensorException - When the Sensor can't be set to the requested value
        See Also:
        Sensor

      • updateInstruments

        private void updateInstruments()
                        throws SensorException
        Sets the Instruments based on the Sensors. Contains different logic for the odometer and trip meter
        Throws:
        SensorException - WHen the Sensor is set outside its valid range
        See Also:
        Sensor, Instrument
